etymologies: mid 16th century: from Latin cithara, from Greek kithara, denoting a kind of harp. The spelling has been influenced by gittern

definitions: a stringed instrument similar to a lute, with a flattened back and wire strings, used in 16th- and 17th-century Europe.
shortDefinitions: stringed instrument similar to lute, with flattened back and wire strings, used in 16th- and 17th-century Europe
